title: In-situ Correlation of the Anomalous Hall Effect with the Occurrence of Topological Magnetic Phases
content: Skyrmions are potential future nanoscale information carriers since they can be electrically manipulated and detected. Magnetic imaging in a transmission electron microscope (TEM) [1], has proven extremely valuable for unveiling the details of these magnetic solitons even in 3D [2]. Hall effect measurements on such spin textures are usually conducted on samples, whose size and morphology differ substantially from those investigated in a TEM. Since the stability of skyrmions is highly sensitive to the sample geometry, the correlation of magneto-transport and TEM data is problematic if not conducted on identical samples.
